page.title: 16Macclesfield Forest
page.content: Macclesfield Forest covers an area of 6 square kilometres approximately. It lies to the east of Langley. It contains a variety of trees ,mainly coniferous with an afforestation manager and helpers to look after it.There are two reservoirs in its area,Trentabank and Ridgegate and on the latter there is now a well established heronry.Red deer ,badgers ,foxes ,rabbits, hares and squirrels can be found in the area and migrant birds use the reservoirs in addition to the usual bird population.The forest area has many beautiful walks within it and is also used by bird watchers,those interested in wild life and flowers which abound.
